result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse Shawn McNeil was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Physical Abuse Of A Child (Intentional Causation Of Bodily Harm)

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence. Straight time.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all supervision fees and all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge during period of probation.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.
-Restitution set at zero.
Obtain/maintain employment. Full time or provide proof as to why he is unable to work

No contact with victims A.E.M. and A.D.L.
No weapons.
No contact with firearms.

Attend and succesfully complete Batterers Intervention Program.
Parenting classes.
Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by agent.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay all supervision fees and all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge during period of probation.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment/tax intercept.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse Shawn McNeil

records.addlTxt: Probation Report Review received and filed.  bm

Defendant Jesse Shawn McNeil in court, in custody.  Attorney Samuel Tufford in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Case calendared for Return on Warrant.  Defendant advised he must maintain compliance with the Department of Corrections and return for his review hearing.   Defendant ordered released WITHOUT bail.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Bench Warrant Cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff.
Original (Copy) bench warrant in file. Case is adjourned for  Return of Bench Warrant in Branch 12.  
Notice is given to the District Attorney's Office.

Defendant Jesse Shawn McNeil not in court.  Attorney Samuel Tufford in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Notice of Completion of Representation by Attorney William Hotchkiss received and filed.  bm
Count three.
Count two
Order Reinstating Phone Privileges signed and filed.  bm

AS TO COUNTS 2 & 3:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty AS AMENDED and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
Court ordered Defendant's phone privileges REINSTATED.  

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 4:  Pursuant to negotations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Counts 1 & 4 dismissed and read-in for purposes of sentencing.
Amended Information received and filed.

Defendant Jesse Shawn McNeil in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Jesse Shawn McNeil in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Jury first call.  Defense has received a new offer from the State and requests time to speak with his client.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Jesse Shawn McNeil in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Jesse Shawn McNeil in custody.  Elizabeth A Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Jury first call.  Defense received videos and additional jail calls this date and needs time to review.  Case passed to 1:30 pm.

SAME DAY, SAME APPEARANCES.  Defendants appearance waived.  Defense did quick review of discovery and needs additional time.  Jury trial scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Order Granting State's Motion to Admit Other Acts signed and filed.  bm
State's Amended Witness List received and filed.  bm

Defendant Jesse Shawn McNeil in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Jesse Shawn McNeil in custody.  Elizabeth A Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Case in court for Decision on Other Acts Motion.  Court allows other acts evidence.  State to draft order.  State's offer placed on the record.  Defendant rejects offer.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial April 11, 2022 at 8:30 am.
Order Granting testimony of Maria Rozek as an expert signed and filed.  bm

Motion hearing exhibits from 03/30/2022 inventoried on this date.
Location: BOX 779

Defendant Jesse Shawn McNeil in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Jesse Shawn McNeil in custody.  Elizabeth A Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Daubert Motion proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  MPD Trauma Counselor Maria Rozek.  Direct examination.  Exhibit #1 & 2 marked, offered and received.  Cross examination.  Arguments heard.  Court finds testimony of Maria Rozek to be allowed at trial.  Final Pretrial motions addressed.  Court adjourns matter for Decision.  Decision scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Curriculum Vitae of Maria Rozek received and filed.  bm

Attorney William Hotchkiss in court, defendant Jesse Shawn McNeil not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth A Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Defendant in custody, not produced.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Based on recent filings, parties request adjourned Final Pretrial and Motion (Daubert) Hearing.  Motion hearing scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defense Motion in Limine received and filed.  bm
Defense Response to State's Motion to Admit Other Acts Evidence received and filed.  bm
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Exclude State's Expert Witness Testimony at Trial received and filed.  bm
State's Motion for the Admission of Evidence received and filed.  bm
State's Motion in Limine received and filed.  bm
State's Witness List received and filed.  bm
Supplemental Notice of Expert Testimony received and filed.  bm
Notice of Expert Testimony received and filed.  bm
Order Rescinding Defendant's Telephone, Visitation and U.S. Mail Privileges signed and filed.  bm

Defendant Jesse Shawn McNeil in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Jesse Shawn McNeil in custody.  Elizabeth A Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  State filed motion to rescind Defendant's privileges.  Court grants request and orders Defendant to be in 24 hour lockdown with phone, visit and mail privileges rescinded.  State to draft an order.  Defense requests a Final Pretrial and Jury Trial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's Motion to Rescind Privileges received and filed.  bm
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Rothstein.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Borowski, Br. 12.

Defendant Jesse Shawn McNeil in court with Attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Jesse Shawn McNeil in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Karr-Hardie.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  This hearing will be streamed live on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCqYxLDHV-xN_RkKf_fE1jjw  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.E.M. (DOB 6/11/91) and A.J.D. (DOB 2/17/11).

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jesse Shawn McNeil in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Jesse Shawn McNeil in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 3 and 4. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
